channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine recommendations at President Trump's direction.
item.content:encoded:
Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine recommendations at President Trump's direction.

(Image credit: Mauro Pimentel)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: After devastating LA fires, California is drafting nation's toughest rules for homes
item.description: California is writing rules to limit plants around buildings to protect them from wildfires, after the Los Angeles fires a year ago. Some homeowners are pushing back over losing their greenery.
item.content:encoded:
California is writing rules to limit plants around buildings to protect them from wildfires, after the Los Angeles fires a year ago. Some homeowners are pushing back over losing their greenery.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: Pentagon will begin review of 'effectiveness' of women in ground combat positions
item.description: The review, outlined in a Pentagon memo obtained by NPR, comes after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told admirals and generals in September that women must meet the "highest male standard."
item.content:encoded:
The review, outlined in a Pentagon memo obtained by NPR, comes after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth told admirals and generals in September that women must meet the "highest male standard."

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: More seniors are becoming homeless. Shelters are trying to adapt
item.description: Older adults are the fastest-growing homeless population across the U.S. Now some shelters are trying to make it easier to accommodate older people.
item.content:encoded:
Older adults are the fastest-growing homeless population across the U.S. Now some shelters are trying to make it easier to accommodate older people.

(Image credit: Aaron Bolton)
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: The criminal prosecution of Nicolás Maduro is underway. Here's what to expect
item.description: Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leader who ruled Venezuela for more than a decade.
item.content:encoded:
Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leader who ruled Venezuela for more than a decade.

(Image credit: Federico Parra)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Trump to meet with House Republicans amid questions about Venezuela
item.description: President Trump is set to meet with House Republicans Tuesday at the Kennedy Center as lawmakers in both chambers are calling for more details on the recent operation in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is set to meet with House Republicans Tuesday at the Kennedy Center as lawmakers in both chambers are calling for more details on the recent operation in Venezuela.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Trump says the U.S. plans to "take back" Venezuela's oil. But what does that mean
item.description: President Trump says the U.S. will "take back" Venezuela's oil. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Jason Bordoff, founding director of Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy, about his remarks.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says the U.S. will "take back" Venezuela's oil. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Jason Bordoff, founding director of Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy, about his remarks.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Progress for Ukraine talks in Paris uncertain with U.S. focus shifting to Venezuela
item.description: Ukraine's allies are meeting Tuesday in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country's security after a potential ceasefire with Russia. But prospects for progress are uncertain.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine's allies are meeting Tuesday in Paris for key talks that could help determine the country's security after a potential ceasefire with Russia. But prospects for progress are uncertain.

(Image credit: Danylo Antoniuk)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Danish prime minister says a US takeover of Greenland would mark the end of NATO
item.description: Her comments came in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed call for the strategic, mineral-rich Arctic island to come under U.S. control in the aftermath of the weekend military operation in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Her comments came in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's renewed call for the strategic, mineral-rich Arctic island to come under U.S. control in the aftermath of the weekend military operation in Venezuela.

(Image credit: Felipe Dana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: This Jan. 6 plaque was made to honor law enforcement. It's nowhere to be found at the Capitol
item.description: Its whereabouts aren't publicly known, though it's believed to be in storage.
item.content:encoded:
Its whereabouts aren't publicly known, though it's believed to be in storage.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
